page.title: 12The Redditch Advertiser.
page.content: Each week{every household}in the area has the Redditch Advertiser delivered free. It was started 10 years ago in 1975 by Chris Bullivant who believed that{free newspapers}made sense; the {advertising}paid for the paper and was sure of being seen by many people. The paper was initially 16 pages and compiled as a{cottage industry}in an amateurish manner on the living room floor of Chris's house. By 1978 the Advertiser was a success and expansion from Redditch began. Today the paper has incorporated the old traditional {Redditch Indicator.}It averages 96 pages and 34 000 copies are delivered weekly. It carries local advertising and an extensive{Property Guide} besides photographs of{local events} and reports of interest to the locality. Schoolchildren deliver the Advertiser each Thursday.
